alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 3:57PM EDT until July 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey... Monmouth. In northern New Jersey...Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Raritan, Sandy Hook-Staten Island, and Mullica-Toms. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Old Bridge, Howell, Marlboro, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, and Matawan. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 95 and 121. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
